content.description: Start with your hands matched on a sharp rail. Pull up, establish feet, and top out via the slab above.
content.location: You can see this boulder from the Red Cross Trail.

content.description: Start at the right side of the boulder where it is blocky with your hands on good slopers. Move to the left with your hands in the horizontal crack until you get to the vertical crack with the baby tree growing in it. Climb past the baby tree with a slopey, slabby topout.
content.location: On a small cliff ~100 feet to the north (left) of Sticky Fingers. Look for the boulder to the east of Red Cross Trail near the top of the ridge.

content.description: These two boulders are located some 100 feet apart along the upper slope of a west-facing granite ridge about 250 feet north of the Red Cross Cliffs along Red Cross Path. The ridgetop is about 150 feet east of the path with a muddy/marshy depression sitting between the path and the ridge.
